notes: On 26 March 2025, unidentified militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) attacked a convoy near the 102 Wing FC Camp near a bus stand in Nushki city (Nushki, Balochistan). According to local sources, three loud explosions and heavy gunfire were heard. BRAS claim three FC personnel were killed and six others were wounded. Military forces are claimed to have deployed surveillance drones following the attack. Fatalities uncorroborated with 3 fatalities coded and 6 injured.

On 25 March 2025, unidentified militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated an IED targeting a security convoy (coded as military) in Iskalkoo area (Kalat, Balochistan), killing one security official and injuring two others, including an officer. 1 fatality and 2 injured.

On 25 March 2025, unidentified assailants (coded as Baloch Separatists) hurled a hand grenade towards Mengalabad police post on Sakran Road in Hub town (Las Bela, Balochistan). The grenade fell inside the post, however, there were no casualties.

notes: On 25 March 2025, BLA militants detonated an IED targeting a military convoy in Harboi area (Kalat, Balochistan). BLA claim five military personnel were killed and three others were wounded. source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter

notes: On 24 March 2025, BLA-Azad militants hurled a hand grenade and wounded two non-local Sindhi civilians near Sheikh Mosque in Kharan city (Kharan, Balochistan). According to Baloch regional sources, intelligence agency personnel were also present in the area during the attack, and are claimed to have been the target of the attack. 2 injured and no fatalities.

On 24 March 2025, BLA militants on motorcycle ambushed military forces during a military operation in Harboi area (Kalat, Balochistan). According to Baloch regional sources, the ambush is claimed to have resulted in several military casualties. BLA claim four military personnel were killed and six others were wounded. The group later released video footage of the attack, showing dead personnel and captured weapons. Fatalities uncorroborated with 4 fatalities and 6 injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter
notes: On 24 March 2025, TTP militants shot dead a former village defence council member of a government-backed peace committee in Swat district (Swat, KPK), when he was on his way to work. 1 fatality.

On 24 March 2025, unidentified gunmen shot dead a JUI-F member and vice chairman of the local chapter in Khairabad area of Karachi - Orangi town (Karachi, Sindh), while he was on his way for morning prayers. The victim was also a suspected fundraiser for the LeT. 1 fatality.

On 23 March 2025, unidentified assailants (coded as Baloch Separatists) shot dead the son of a retired police station house officer (SHO) in Nal Dad Shah Market in Naal area (Khuzdar, Balochistan). Assailants fled after the attack. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter
notes: On 23 March 2025, military forces intercepted and killed 16 TTP militants attempting to infiltrate the Pakistan-Afghanistan border in Ghulam Khan tehsil (North Waziristan, KPK). After an intense exchange of fire, 16 militants were killed with no military casualties. 16 fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 23 March 2025, military forces intercepted and killed at least 13 TTP militants after they crossed across the Pakistan-Afghanistan border into Mehsud area of South Waziristan district (coded as Wana (South Waziristan, KPK)), in three separate fire exchanges in the district. Military sources claim the militants included Afghan nationals, and a local commander of the TTP. At least 13 fatalities.

On 23 March 2025, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) detonated a roadside explosive targeting a police personnel in Lowi Sam area (Bajaur, KPK), when the police personnel was off-duty and on his way home. The police personnel remained unhurt in the explosion. There were no casualties.

On 23 March 2025, militants (coded as TTP) fired rockets at the Jhangi police check post in Jhangi area (coded as Taunsa, Dera Ghazi Khan, Punjab). Police personnel retaliated, killing 1 militant and the others escaped. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 March 2025, unidentified armed persons (coded as Baloch Separatists) on motorcycles shot dead four police personnel patrolling in Gharibabad area of Nushki city (Nushki, Balochistan) using automatic weapons. 4 fatalities.

source: Balochistan Post; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal

notes: On 16 March 2025, BLA militants attacked an FC convoy comprised of eight vehicles, six coaches, and two cars, on Quetta-Taftan Highway near Darkhshan flour mill in Rakhshani area (coded as Nushki, Balochistan), on its way from Nokundi to Quetta. BLA militants fired an RPG towards the coach, with a BLA vehicle-borne suicide bomber subsequently ramming an explosive-laden vehicle into an FC vehicle. Five persons, including three FC personnel and two civilians, were killed and forty others were wounded in the explosion. Following the explosion, BLA militants hiding in the nearby mountains opened fire, resulting in a fire exchange between FC personnel and militants. Three BLA militants were killed in the clash. BLA claim 90 FC personnel were killed in the attack, however, official and independent sources mentioned 8 fatalities (3 FC, 2 drivers and 3 militants) and 40 injured. 8 fatalities coded based on the lowest estimate.

notes: On 16 March 2025, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a senior Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant leader - also the nephew of the group's co-founder - and his driver while they were inside their vehicle in Dina city (Jhelum, Punjab). A private security guard accompanying them was also wounded in the attack. The LeT leader had been involved with Jamaat-ud-Dawa, the group's welfare wing, following a period of dormancy from militant operations in Kashmir. According to a senior security official, the slain LeT militant had secretly defected from the group and was part of a larger network linked to a 'hostile' intelligence operation (likely Indian, due to recent killing of anti-Indian Kashmiri militants) aiming to infiltrate LeT and conduct targeted assassinations of its own leadership. On the other hand, Indian sources claimed that the deceased was a trusted handler of the LeT chief and was wanted by Indian security agencies for militant attacks in Kashmir. 2 fatalities and 1 injured.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-); Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Frontier Corps
source: Al Jazeera; BBC News; Dawn (Pakistan); Express Tribune (Pakistan); Guardian (United Kingdom); Khorasan Diary; NYT; Reuters; South Asia Terrorism Portal; VOA
notes: On 12 March 2025, SSG military commandos, FC, and Police personnel continued a counter-operation against BLA militants that had hijacked the Jaffar Express train and taken passengers hostage near Tunnel 8 in Mashkaf area (Kachhi, Balochistan), while helicopter gunships provided cover as ground troops advanced toward the train. Previously, dozens of BLA militants hijacked the passenger train, which was carrying civilians and off-duty military personnel, resulting in 26 passenger deaths (coded separately). According to military officials, SSG commandos executed a 'bogey-by-bogey' clearance operation, systematically securing each compartment. During the assault, 23 militants and one military personnel were killed. Over the two-day counter-operation, a total of 38 persons, including 33 militants and 5 security personnel were killed, of which 24 persons are believed to have been killed on the second day. 38 fatalities split across two days, 24 fatalities coded to this event.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Pakistan (2022-); Labor Group (Pakistan); Military Forces of Pakistan (2022-)
source: Al Jazeera; Balochistan Post; BBC News; Dawn (Pakistan); Express Tribune (Pakistan); Guardian (United Kingdom); Khorasan Diary; NYT; Reuters; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal; VOA
notes: On 11 March 2025, between 50-70 BLA militants attacked and hijacked the Jaffar Express train carrying approximately 400 passengers-including civilians and at least 80 off-duty military personnel-traveling from Quetta to Peshawar near Tunnel 8 in Mashkaf area (Kachhi, Balochistan) in a coordinated attack. Militants first detonated explosives on the railway track, causing the train to derail. Shortly after, they stormed the train, armed with guns, rockets, and additional explosives, and opened fire on passengers. They seized control of the locomotive and targeted security personnel onboard while taking hostages. Attackers conducted identification checks, releasing at least 80 civilians, including women, children, and Baloch passengers, while detaining security personnel and non-Balochis. BLA claim to have taken between 182 and 214 hostages, including over 100 military personnel, whereas government sources claimed that a lesser number of hostages were taken in groups of ten by BLA suicide squads. The BLA issued a 48-hour ultimatum, demanding political prisoners' release in exchange for hostages. 26 people, including 18 off-duty military personnel, three railway employees, and five civilian passengers were killed in the initial attack.

On 11 March 2025, BLF militants hurled a hand grenade towards a military intelligence (MI) office on Gazi Road in Red Zone area of Kharan city (Kharan, Balochistan). According to local sources, heavy explosions were heard during the attack. No casualties.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-); Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Frontier Corps
source: Al Jazeera; Balochistan Post; BBC News; Dawn (Pakistan); Express Tribune (Pakistan); Guardian (United Kingdom); Khorasan Diary; NYT; Reuters; South Asia Terrorism Portal; VOA
notes: On 11 March 2025, SSG military commandos, FC, and Police personnel launched a counter-operation targeting BLA militants who had hijacked the Jaffar Express train and taken passengers hostage near Tunnel 8 in Mashkaf area (Kachhi, Balochistan). The operation was conducted with aerial surveillance and air support. Earlier that day, dozens of BLA militants hijacked the passenger train, carrying civilians and off-duty military personnel, resulting in the deaths of 26 passengers (coded separately). In response, military forces executed a drone strike, targeting a group of BLA militants outside the train, killing around ten militants. During the initial engagement, at least one FC personnel was killed. Meanwhile, at a railway picket near the track, three FC personnel were killed when BLA fighters opened fire from an elevated position. Over the two-day counter-operation, a total of 38 persons, including 33 militants and 5 security personnel were killed, of which around 14 persons are suspected to have been killed on the first day. 38 fatalities split across two events, 14 fatalities coded to this event.

On 11 March 2025, BLA militants attacked a convoy of vehicles carrying natural minerals along the China Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) Road in Kech district (coded as Turbat (Kech, Balochistan)). There were no casualties.

Pakistani authorities also claimed that Afghan nationals participated in the attack. 34 fatalities, including 16 militants, 13 civilians, and 5 military personnel, with 32 other civilians wounded.

Immediately after the explosion, two militants attempted to breach the compound but were shot dead by FC personnel. A prolonged exchange of gunfire followed, resulting in the deaths of two additional militants and two FC personnel. Earlier sources claimed that two militants were killed in a grenade attack, however, mainstream, official military and TTP sources later confirmed the attack was a vehicle-borne IED attack with seven fatalities, including five militants and two FC personnel, and eleven other FC personnel injured. 7 fatalities and 11 injured.

Footage released by the BLA shows militants waiting in nearby fields for the bus, while other videos reveal the bus completely destroyed by the blast. The BLA claimed that the bus was carrying military personnel, claiming that 11 were killed and 28 others wounded. However, mainstream sources confirm that the passengers were civilians. Two people, including a passenger and a cleaner, were killed, and seven others-among them the bus driver-were injured. 2 fatalities coded based on the lowest estimate, and 7 injured.

The clashes killed 21 persons in Bagan area, and left at least 37 people killed and 25 others wounded across both locations, resulting in 84 fatalities by 23 November. During the clashes, Zainabiyoun Brigade militants abducted six women, while 300 shops along with 100 houses were destroyed. Sectarian clashes between Shia and Sunni groups erupted following the killing of 47 Shia civilians on 21 November 2024 (coded separately). Fatalities corroborated with 21 fatalities were coded to this event.

The incident follows a rise in sectarian violence in Kurram district after tribal clashes between Shia and Sunni communities. notes: On 9 November 2024, military forces engaged in a firefight with 20-25 TTP-HGB militants attempting to infiltrate the Pakistan-Afghanistan border near the Kaitu River in Spinwam area (North Waziristan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). A significant cache of arms and ammunition was also recovered from the site. Security forces are also suspected to have used a quadcopter during the clash. 6 fatalities and 3 injured.

source: Al Jazeera; Balochistan Post; BBC News; Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; News International (Pakistan); South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 9 November 2024, a BLA militant disguised as a passenger carried out a suicide bomb attack using an eight-kilogram explosive, targeting military personnel from the infantry school and numerous passengers at Platform 1 near the ticket counter of Quetta Railway Station in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). The attack, which occurred as people awaited the Peshawar-bound train, resulted in at least 26 fatalities, including the attacker, 14 military infantry personnel, and 12 civilians (of which at least six were railway employees), and injured 62 others, including 46 military personnel. The explosion damaged a shelter and an overhead crossing bridge. Video footage shows the crowded platform erupting as the militant, suspected to be within the dense gathering, detonated the bomb. The BLA has previously conducted coordinated attacks across the province, including in August 2024, but this marks one of the first significant attacks in the centre of the provincial capital. 26 fatalities coded based on the lowest estimate.

On 8 November 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as Baloch Separatists) on motorcycle shot dead a man suspected to have belonged to a government-backed 'death squad' (coded as pro-government militia) outside his residence in Kohar area in Tump tehsil (Kech, Balochistan). 1 fatality.

Military forces also recovered weapons and ammunitions during the operation. 1 fatality and 1 injured.

The incident occurred a day after the government launched a nationwide polio campaign on October 28, 2024, following a resurgence of polio cases. 5 fatalities.

The personnel were later released, and militants fled with the weapons. The government began a nationwide polio campaign on 28 October 2024, after a resurgence of polio cases.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal

The attack left five personnel dead and one wounded. The militants also seized the personnel's weapons, set construction machinery ablaze, and burned two nearby rooms, labeling the dam as an 'exploitative project' opposing the Baloch independence movement. 5 fatalities.

On 28 October 2024, a youth was 'tortured' and killed in police custody in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh). He was arrested in a theft case lodged by an 'influential' figure of the area. The police claimed that the suspect died of suicide and that he used his waist-string to kill himself in the lock-up, but his family denied this account. A government inquiry has been launched into the custodial death.

notes: On 28 October 2024, TTP militants detonated an IED targeting a police van in Bizan Khel area (Bannu, KPK), as the vehicle was en route to support a polio vaccination team. The van sustained partial damage, however, there were no casualties.

On 27 October 2024, military forces conducted an intelligence-based operation (IBO) targeting two suspected TTP militants in North Waziristan district (coded as Mir Ali (North Waziristan, KPK)). After an intense exchange of fire, two militants were killed. 2 fatalities.

On 27 October 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as TTP) abducted three employees of the government-owned Pakistan Telecommunication Company from North Waziristan district (coded as Mir Ali (North Waziristan, KPK)) while they were working in the field. In response, the government has issued travel advisories to other district employees, warning of potential abduction threats from militants targeting government officials in the region.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 27 October 2024, military forces conducted an intelligence-based operation (IBO) targeting TTP militants in Khyber district (coded as Bara (Khyber, KPK)). After an exchange of fire, two militants were killed and three other militants were wounded. 2 fatalities and 3 injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 October 2024, unidentified militants (coded as TTP) conducted an IED targeting a convoy of security force vehicles (coded as military) in Gul Imam area (Tank, KPK). There were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 October 2024, a TTP-HGB militant travelling in a rickshaw carried out a suicide bombing at a joint military and police checkpoint in Idak area (North Waziristan, KPK). The attack resulted in the deaths of nine individuals, including the bomber, two civilians, and six security personnel- four police officers and two military personnel. Several vehicles were also damaged. While some sources reported that additional armed TTP-HGB militants exchanged fire with security forces following the explosion, mainstream sources confirmed that no other militants were involved after the initial attack. Recently, TTP-HGB militants had attempted to conduct an IED attack when the bomb prematurely exploded and killed the militant on 25 October 2024 (coded separately). Following the attack, TTP-HGB released a statement identifying the suicide bomber involved in the attack. 9 fatalities coded.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 October 2024, TTP militants abducted an FC personnel from a mosque in Ali Khel locality of Mattani area (Peshawar, KPK). The personnel was later released on 28 October 2024 after local tribal elders intervened and provided guarantees to militants, including PKR 200,000, along with his gun and 75-rounds of magazine.

Around 26 October 2024 (as reported), TTP-HGB affiliated militants claim to have abducted a Russian travel vlogger from Dera Ismail Khan district (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). TTP-HGB released images showing the Russian civilian seated with two suspected militants. While a military source in Pakistan dismissed the claims as 'fake,' a Russian diplomatic source confirmed receiving information about the abduction of a Russian citizen. Russian government officials stated that the matter was under investigation. Since then, neither the Pakistani nor Russian governments have issued an official statement.

On 26 October 2024, BLA militants abducted an individual claimed to have belonged to a 'death squad' (coded as pro-government militia) from Tal area in Hoshab tehsil (Kech, Balochistan). The individual was later recovered dead on 29 October 2024 (coded separately).

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 October 2024, unidentified militants (coded as TTP) shot dead an off-duty police head constable in Mira Khel area (Bannu, KPK), when he was on his way to the mosque for prayers. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 October 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) detonated explosives targeting the residence of a former JUI-F senator in Khaisoor area in Tiarza tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK). The former senator's son claimed that individuals also stormed the house and opened fire, though the family remained unharmed. However, police sources claim militants had only planted an explosive near the former senator's residence. The JUI-F member also claimed that he had received extortion calls from unidentified persons prior to the attack threatening his family, and stated that the attack could have been related to his refusal to pay extortion. No casualties.

On 26 October 2024, SRA militants hurled a hand grenade towards Khursheed Police Post in Kotri Site area of Jamshoro District (Jamshoro, Sindh). They claimed that the attack was in response to claimed harassments, injuries and arrests of Sindhi nationalist activists by the police. No casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, security forces (coded as military) and militants (coded as TTP) exchanged fire in the border areas of Khyber district (coded as Jamrud (Khyber, KPK)), alongside Afghanistan. During an exchange of fire, two security personnel and two militants were killed, while three security personnel were also wounded. 4 fatalities and 3 injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire on a joint FC and Police forces check post in Nawagai area (Bajaur, KPK). Police and FC personnel opened retaliatory fire, forcing the militants to flee the scene. There were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead an under-training military cadet during prayers inside a mosque in Sarai Naurang town (Lakki Marwat, KPK), while he was home on holiday. Two other worshippers nearby were also injured in the gunfire. Military sources claim the cadet fought back with the militants, however, the militants are suspected to have escaped the scene unharmed after the attack. 1 fatality and 2 injured.

On 25 October 2024, around two dozen unidentified assailants attacked prison vans carrying 82 prisoners, including three KP MPAs (PTI), at the outskirts of Islamabad in Islamabad city (Islamabad, FCT). The prisoners were being transported back to Attock Jail after a court hearing. Several prisoners escaped but they were later apprehended. The attackers were carrying weapons, sticks and stones and fired at the prison van, injuring 4 police personnel.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, unidentified assailants shot dead a JUI-F affiliate in Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, TTP militants opened fire at the vehicle of a police station house officer (SHO), alongside his guard, at Jani Khel Jail in Janikhel area (Bannu, KPK). The SHO and the guard were killed, while a passerby was also wounded in the attack. 2 fatalities and 1 injured.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, TTP militants ambushed and opened fire on a police mobile van patrolling on Purdilkhel Road in Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). Police opened retaliatory fire and killed two militants. Arms and ammunitions were also recovered from the area. 2 fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 October 2024, TTP militants conducted an IED attack targeting the vehicle of a police station house officer (SHO) in Wana town (South Waziristan, KPK) when the SHO, along with a constable, were on their way home. On 24 October 2024, unidentified armed persons fatally shot a person and abducted another in Chhapar area of Kalat district (Kalat, Balochistan), before fleeing the scene. Following the attack, relatives held a protest demanding justice for the deceased and the safe recovery of the abducted individual (coded separately). It remains unclear if this incident is linked to suspected cases of Baloch enforced disappearances and extrajudicial actions. 1 fatality.

source: Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 24 October 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated a motorcycle-laden IED targeting a tribal elder near Junction Chowk in Qila Saifullah district (Killa Saifullah, Balochistan). The explosion occurred outside a shop while the elder was having lunch with friends, injuring six people, including the elder. 6 injured and no fatalities.

On 24 October 2024, BLA militants shot dead a man claimed to have been an informant for the Military Intelligence (MI) agency in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). BLA claim the individual had provided assistance to military, intelligence, and pro-government militias in the area, as well conduct recruitment for military forces. 1 fatality.

On 24 October 2024, BLF militants hurled a hand grenade towards military personnel at Bund-e-Bin Dukram chowk in Apsar area of Turbat city (Kech, Balochistan), when military personnel stationed had blocked the road. BLF claim two military personnel were killed in the attack. Fatalities uncorroborated, with 2 fatalities coded.

notes: On 23 October 2024, BLA militants fired three mortar shells targeting an FC Cantonment on Hali Road in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). The attack also damaged an electric pole, causing power outages in various parts of the city. There were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 23 October 2024, intervening night, military forces conducted an intelligence-based operation (IBO) targeting TTP militants in Bajaur district (coded as Khar (Bajaur, KPK)). After an exchange of fire, nine militants, including a high-value target and two suicide attackers, were killed. A large cache of arms were also recovered during the operation. 9 fatalities.

At least two persons were wounded in the explosion, while the militants immediately fled the scene. 2 injured and no fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 October 2024, unidentified militants (coded as TTP) hurled hand grenades at a police check post near a market in Inayat Kalle area (Bajaur, KPK). However, no exchange of fire was claimed by local sources. 5 injured and no fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire on the vehicle of a station house officer (SHO) in Shadi Khel area of Lakki Marwat district (Lakki Marwat, KPK). Although the vehicle sustained minor damage, there were no casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 October 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) shot dead a police personnel in front of his house (likely off-duty, as he was near his residence) in Sarai Naurang town (Lakki Marwat, KPK). 1 fatality.

On 22 October 2024, three militants (coded as TTP) opened fire at a police personnel inside a guestroom in Naserkhel area in Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). The officer, who was on leave and spending time with companions in his home village, was killed in the attack. The assailants took his rifle before fleeing the scene. 1 fatality.

source: Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; Sangar Publication
notes: On 22 October 2024, military forces engaged in a firefight with TTP militants in Sabura area of Barshor tehsil (Pishin, Balochistan), following a suspected border infiltration. Five armed militants entered from the Pakistan-Afghanistan border in a vehicle and opened fire on military personnel. According to officials, one militant detonated a suicide device, killing himself and a companion. Another assailant was killed in the exchange, while the remaining two fled the scene. 3 fatalities.

source: Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 21 October 2024, unidentified gunmen (coded as Baloch Separatists) opened fire at the vehicle of a local PPP leader on the highway in Bawani Sarai area (Las Bela, Balochistan). The PPP local leader was wounded in the attack and later succumbed to injuries and died.

On 21 October 2024, BLF militants conducted a sniper attack at a military check post at Ganda Corps in Bazdad area (Awaran, Balochistan). BLF claim one military personnel was killed. Fatalities uncorroborated, with 1 fatality coded.
On 21 October 2024, BLF militants attacked a military post in Dal Kuk area in Zamuran tehsil (Kech, Balochistan). There were no casualties.

On 21 October 2024, three unidentified armed persons attacked and killed two transgender persons by slitting their throats with a dagger inside their residence in Mardan town (Mardan, KPK), in a suspected targeted attack. Police apprehended the three attackers on 24 October 2024. While the exact motive behind the attack is unclear, transgender individuals in the region frequently face harassment and violence, with some falling victim to 'honour killings' carried out by relatives to punish perceived sexual transgressions. 2 fatalities.

On 21 October 2024, a quadcopter drone was used to drop explosives at Peer Mela marketplace in Tirah Valley (Khyber, KPK), injuring 13 civilians, primarily children who were struck by shrapnel. There are conflicting reports on who initiated the strike. Most sources suggest that the explosion was a military drone strike targeting militants. However, other sources noted an increase in the use of quadcopter drones by TTP militants in the area in recent months. Neither the military nor the TTP has claimed responsibility for the attack. There were 13 injuries with no fatalities.

On 20 October 2024, two groups of Jagirani clan clashed in Ghouspur area (Rahim Yar Khan, Punjab), after one group objected to the grazing of the other group's animals on their farmland. Both sides exchanged fire, killing 6 and injuring 3.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal

The officer was attacked as he was leaving the mosque after prayers. A neighbour accompanying him was also injured in the assault. 1 fatality and 1 injured.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 19 October 2024, military forces conducted an intelligence-based operation (IBO) targeting militants (likely TTP, due to previous operations targeting group in the area) in Zhob district (Zhob, Balochistan), alongside the borders of the KPK province. After an exchange of fire, two militants were killed. 2 fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter
notes: On 19 October 2024, members of the Takhtikhel tribal lashkar (militia) in Lakki Marwat district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, shot and killed one TTP commander after the militants attempted to detain four young men from the local community. During the exchange of gunfire, one local resident was also killed. A CTD patrol team later arrived at the scene and engaged in a firefight with the militants. Following the incident, the TTP issued a statement urging local tribal communities to avoid joining armed tribal militias. The clash resulted in two fatalities and one injury.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 19 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) attacked a military check post in Spinkai Ragjazai area (South Waziristan, KPK). After an exchange of fire, one militant was killed and eight military personnel were injured. 1 fatality.

On 19 October 2024, two factions of the TTP exchanged gunfire in the mountainous areas between Nandron and Nargasai in Birmal tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK). The clash began when TTP militants from the Ada Khel tribe, operating in Lower South Waziristan, were attacked by newly arrived TTP fighters from Afghanistan. Although the exact motive remains unclear, the conflict is believed to be linked to disputes over control of operational areas. Four militants from the Ada Khel tribe, including a local commander, were killed in the incident. 4 fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 19 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated a roadside IED targeting a routine FC convoy on Tank Road near Hathala Police Station in Hathala area (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). Two FC personnel were wounded in the explosion. Following the blast, the militants opened fire on the convoy, prompting FC personnel to return fire, which forced the attackers to flee. 2 injured and no fatalities.

source: Balochistan Post; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal

The BLF claims that Levies personnel initiated the attack, though this account remains unconfirmed. 1 fatality and 2 injured.

On 18 October 2024, armed local residents (likely Shiite militia, due to target of attack) chased down two armed assailants (likely Sunni militia, based on related event coded separately) and shot both of them in Shingkak area (Kurram, KPK), after the armed assailants had opened fire on residents workings in the field (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 18 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire on police forces at a check post near Lora Bridge in Fatehkhel area of Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). Police forces opened retaliatory fire, and forced the militants to flee the scene. The attack resulted in damaging the police building, however, no persons were harmed during the attack. No casualties.

source: Aaj News; Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 18 October 2024, unidentified assailants (likely Sunni militia, due to target of attack) on motorcycle opened fire and shot dead two Shiite Muslims working in the fields in Shingkak area (Kurram, KPK), in a suspected sectarian-motivated attack, in the Shiite-dominated area of Kurram district. Two persons were killed and three others were wounded in the attack. Recently, sectarian violence has resurfaced in the district after Shiite and Sunni groups exchanged fire on 12 October 2024 (coded separately). 2 fatalities and 3 injured.
On 17 October 2024, a man was killed and another injured in a police encounter during a police raid at Chak 94 GB Shahkot Road in Jaranwala town (Faisalabad, Punjab), to apprehend robbers.

On 17 October 2024, BLF militants opened fire at a military check post on Ghazi Road in Kharan city (Kharan, Balochistan) using automatic weapons and grenade launchers. BLF claim one military personnel was killed in the attack. Fatalities uncorroborated, with 1 fatality coded.

On 17 October 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated an IED targeting a police mobile van conducting routine patrol in Urmar area in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). The vehicle was slightly damaged, however, there were no casualties.

On 17 October 2024, intelligence agency personnel (coded as military) are suspected to have abducted the husband of a BNP-M senator from Parliament Lodges in Islamabad city (Islamabad, FCT). The incident is suspected to be linked to the senator's opposition to the 26th Constitutional Amendments, which propose expanding executive authority and altering judicial independence. The senator's son was earlier abducted from Islamabad city on 16 October 2024 (coded separately).

On 17 October 2024, BLF militants ambushed and opened fire on military forces in Shah Batal area in Kolwa tehsil (Kech, Balochistan), when personnel were providing protection to vehicles carrying rations towards the camp. BLF claim three military personnel were killed and two others were wounded. BLF also claims that military personnel wounded a civilian child in retaliatory fire. Fatalities uncorroborated, with 3 fatalities coded and 3 injured.

source: Balochistan Post; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 17 October 2024, BLA militants ambushed and attacked a military convoy on CPEC Road in Tijaban area (Kech, Balochistan). According to local sources, military personnel suffered casualties. BLA claim one military personnel was killed and four others were wounded. Fatalities uncorroborated, with 1 fatality coded and 4 others injured.

On 16 October 2024, two SRA militants on a motorcycle hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a senior PPP leader and president of the PPP Sindh Chapter in Larkana town (Larkana, Sindh). However, the grenade failed to clear the high walls of the house and did not enter the property. No one was harmed, and no damage was caused in the attack. Shortly afterward, however, he retracted his statements, under suspected pressure from intelligence agency personnel.

notes: On 11 October 2024, 30 to 40 militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) stormed a private coal mine near Duki city (Loralai, Balochistan) and opened indiscriminate fire on laborers, most of whom were asleep. A security guard briefly resisted before being shot. Armed with hand grenades, rocket launchers, and automatic weapons, the assailants killed 20 laborers and the security guard, while wounding seven others. Some miners were shot inside their rooms, while others were lined up outside their quarters before being shot. The militants also set fire to and destroyed ten mines, extraction equipment, and machinery. Among the victims, four were Afghan nationals, while the others were residents of Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK). Some sources claimed that BLA had claimed responsibility for the attack. BLA militants later denied responsibility for the attack, claiming the allegation was made by authorities to spread discord between ethnic groups. The incident resulted in 21 fatalities and 7 injuries.

notes: On 1 October 2024, BLF militants on motorcycle hurled a hand grenade towards FC 168 Wing check post at Taleemi Chowk in Turbat city (Kech, Balochistan), and fled the scene. BLF claim one FC personnel was killed, and two others were wounded. According to other sources, two FC personnel were wounded with no other fatalities. Fatalities coded as 0 based on the lowest estimate.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 1 October 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) on motorcycle shot dead a local government chairman of a village council, and wounded another passerby, near Mir Alam Manji Wala area (Lakki Marwat, KPK). 1 fatality and 1 injured.

On 1 October 2024, BLF militants attacked a military camp in Zarin Janglat area (Nushki, Balochistan) using rocket launchers and assault weapons. BLF claim they destroyed the front section of the camp and caused the deaths of three military personnel. However, these claims of fatalities remain uncorroborated. 3 fatalities.

On 30 September 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as Baloch Separatists) shot dead a tribal elder belonging to the Shahizai clan of the Mengal tribe near Tak area in Wadh town (Khuzdar, Balochistan), while he was on his way to the market. Although the exact motive for the attack is unclear, the Mengal tribe has played a prominent and active role in Balochistan's nationalist movement, both in militancy and mainstream politics. 1 fatality.

source: Balochistan Post; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 30 September 2024, BLA militants fired rocket shelling towards military personnel at a camp in Rudban area of Tump tehsil (Kech, Balochistan). According to local sources, sounds of heavy firing and explosion were heard from the area. BLA claimed to have conducted another attack in the area during the same time (coded separately). The BLA also claimed that two military personnel were killed and three others wounded in the attack, though these fatalities remain uncorroborated. 2 fatalities and 3 injured.

source: Balochistan Post; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 30 September 2024, BLA militants attacked military personnel stationed at Shahap Cross in Rudban area of Tump tehsil (Kech, Balochistan) using grenade launchers and other weapons. BLA claim to have conducted another attack in the area during the same time (coded separately). The BLA also claimed that two military personnel were wounded in the attack. 2 injured and no fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 30 September 2024, gunmen (coded as TTP) attacked Wenai police post in Matta area (Swat, KPK). One police personnel was wounded in the initial attack. Police personnel alongside local armed residents opened retaliatory fire against militants, forcing them to flee from the scene. Militants subsequently attacked another police station in Malam Jabba area and clashed with police personnel and armed residents (coded separately). 1 injured and no fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 30 September 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as TTP) opened fire at a police station in Malam Jabba area (Swat, KPK), shortly after escaping from an earlier assault on another police post in Matta tehsil (coded separately). In response, police personnel, supported by local armed residents engaged the militants in a firefight and forced them to flee the scene. No fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Frontier Corps
notes: On 29 September 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) detonated a roadside IED and wounded an FC personnel in Deley area of Ladha tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK) as he was passing through the area. 1 injured and no fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Frontier Corps
notes: On 29 September 2024, BLA militants hurled two hand grenades at an FC camp in Harnai district (Harnai, Balochistan). BLA claim five FC personnel were wounded in the attack. No fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 29 September 2024, unidentified persons (coded as TTP) shot and killed the son of a serving deputy superintendent of police (DSP) in Dera Ismail Khan district (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). His body was recovered from the fields in Abdul Khel area. 1 fatality.

source: Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 28 September 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as Baloch Separatists) on motorcycles shot dead a senior BNP-M leader, and wounded his cousin, on Kirani Road in Kali Geo area in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). The leader, a member of the party's central executive committee, was attacked while passing through the area on motorcycles with his cousin. 1 fatality.

On 28 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated a bomb targeting a military convoy in Mehlabi area in Kalat district (Kalat, Balochistan). According to local sources, an unspecified number of military personnel were wounded in the attack. Casualties unknown.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 28 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated a roadside IED targeting a police vehicle in Bhai Cheena locality near Inayat Kalle area (Bajaur, KPK). Nine police personnel, including the police station house officer (SHO), were wounded. The vehicle was also severely damaged in the attack, when it was on its way back to the police station. 9 injured and no fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 28 September 2024, several militants from the TTP, JuA, and LeI launched a joint attack on security forces (coded as military) stationed at a check post in Tirah Valley (Khyber, KPK). The assault resulted in the deaths of four security personnel, with nine others sustaining injuries. Additionally, two personnel went missing. JuA militants released a video jointly claiming responsibility for the attack, showing scenes of militants torching vehicles. 4 fatalities and 9 injured. The whereabouts of 2 security personnel are unknown.

On 28 September 2024, BLA hurled two hand grenades towards a government ran anti-narcotics camp at Ilias Fish Company Road in Pasni town (Gwadar, Balochistan). According to sources, sounds of two explosions were heard. According to the police, no persons were wounded in the attack. No fatalities.

On 28 September 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated an IED targeting the vehicle of the sub-district tax officer's son in Tump area (Kech, Balochistan). The vehicle was partially damaged, however, the individual remained unhurt in the attack. No fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 28 September 2024, TTP militants attacked a police post in Tangi area (Bajaur, KPK) using rockets and gunfire. Police sources reported that the personnel stationed at the post returned fire, forcing the militants to flee. There were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Radio Pakistan; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 28 September 2024, militants suspected to have belonged to the BLA stormed an under-construction residence and shot dead seven laborers, and wounded another, belonging to the Punjabi ethnic group in Khuda-i-Abada area in Panjgur town (Panjgur, Balochistan) using automatic weapons. The laborers were non-local residents belonging to Multan district (Punjab) and were staying at a rented house, when militants entered and opened fire. According to some reports, the residence housed nine laborers at the time; eight were present and shot at, resulting in seven fatalities, while the ninth laborer was not at the location during the attack. The government has claimed the BLA was behind the attack, however, no group has claimed responsibility. 7 fatalities and 1 injured.

On 27 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) attacked a police van escorting anti-polio vaccination health workers in Gul Imam area (Tank, KPK). While the vehicle was partially damaged, there were no casualties. No fatalities.

On 27 September 2024, rival groups belonging to the Shiite Tribal Militias and Sunni Tribal Militias clashed in Pewar area (Kurram, KPK), as well as in Khar Kalle, Balishkel, Sadda, Kunj Alizai, and Maqbal areas (coded separately). At least five more persons were killed and around 15 others were wounded in these clashes. Sectarian tensions between Shiite and Sunni tribal militia groups broke out over a land dispute and continued for several days in the area, resulting in around 46 fatalities and over 100 wounded as of 27 September 2024. 5 fatalities split across 6 events. 1 fatality coded to this event.

On 27 September 2024, rival groups belonging to the Shiite Tribal Militias and Sunni Tribal Militias clashed in Kunj Alizai area (Kurram, KPK), as well as in Khar Kalle, Balishkel, Sadda, Pewar, and Maqbal areas (coded separately). source: Khorasan Diary; News International (Pakistan); South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 September 2024, a child working as a refuse collector was killed when a hand grenade, left by unidentified individuals (coded as TTP), detonated after he picked it up from a garbage can near the Khazana Sugar Mill area in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). 1 fatality.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 26 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead a military personnel in a sniper attack in Ladha town (South Waziristan, KPK). The personnel was critically wounded in the attack and later succumbed to injuries. 1 fatality.

source: Balochistan Post; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication
notes: On 26 September 2024, unidentified armed persons (coded as Baloch Separatists) opened fire on a vehicle carrying chromite minerals on Basima Road in Kunri Cross area of Kharan district (Kharan, Balochistan). Militants later forced the drivers to disembark and left them unharmed. No casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; News International (Pakistan); Twitter
notes: On 26 September 2024, an explosion occurred at a police station caused by explosive material claimed to have been planted by TTP militants in Swabi district (Swabi, KPK). The TTP claimed responsibility, stating that the explosives had been placed inside the station. However, police and government officials claim that the blast was triggered by a short-circuit or 600 kilogram of explosives stored in the evidence room, which contained recovered militant materials. An official investigation has been launched. Surveillance footage of the incident shows a large flame erupting within the station, followed by a powerful explosion. The blast resulted in the deaths of two police personnel and left more than 26 others wounded, including 17 police officers and nine prisoners. 2 fatality and 26 wounded.

On 26 September 2024, rival groups belonging to the Shiite Tribal Militias and Sunni Tribal Militias clashed with heavy weapons and mortar guns in Trimanal, Baghki and Maqbal areas (coded as Parachinar, Kurram, KPK) along with Balishkhel, Khar Kalle and Kunj Alizai (coded separately). At least 11 persons were killed and over 10 were wounded in these clashes. Sectarian tensions between Shiite and Sunni tribal militia groups broke out over a land dispute and continued for several days in the area, resulting in around 41 fatalities and 88 wounded as of 26 September 2024. 11 fatalities split across four events. 3 fatalities coded to this event.

Sectarian tensions between Shiite and Sunni tribal militia groups broke out over a land dispute and continued for several days in the area, resulting in around 39 fatalities and 88 wounded as of 26 September 2024. notes: On 26 September 2024, ISKP militants opened fire and shot dead a police personnel (likely off-duty, as he was traveling with relatives) and wounded two other passengers, including the personnel's brother and friend, in Khar town (Bajaur, KPK). While initial reports suggested that all the passengers were police personnel, later reports clarified that they were relatives of the deceased personnel. 1 fatality and 2 injured.
On 26 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire and wounded a security personnel (coded as military) at a check post near Makin city (South Waziristan, KPK).

On 26 September 2024, a coal-laden vehicle struck a landmine planted by BLA militants in Chamalang area in Kohlu district (Kohlu, Balochistan). The vehicle was partially destroyed, but the driver remained unharmed. No fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 September 2024, five masked militants (coded as TTP) opened fire on a police van in the Asharay area of Matta tehsil (Swat, KPK), wounding two police personnel. In response, police forces and members of the 'Aman Lashkar,' a local pro-government peace militia, returned fire, killing two suspected militants during the exchange. The remaining three militants fled the scene. Recently, the Aman Lashkar militias, composed of local armed volunteers supporting the government, were reinstated by the government after several years of absence in the region. They are now working alongside the police, particularly during anti-polio vaccination campaigns, to combat militants. 2 fatalities and 2 injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire at a police post in Nasir Bagh area in the outskirts of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). A heavy contingent of police arrived to retaliate, forcing the militants to flee the scene. No fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire at a police station house officer and his family in Tank district (Tank, KPK). During the exchange of gunfire between the militants and police, the officer's nephew was killed. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated a parked motorcycle-laden IED targeting a police vehicle in Bhosa Mandi area in the Eastern Bypass of Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). The militants are suspected to have triggered the IED using a remote-controlled device when the police vehicle reached the spot. A police constable and a driver of the vehicle, alongside ten other passerby civilians were wounded in the explosion. The mobile police vehicle was also damaged in the explosion. 12 wounded and no fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) fired two rockets towards a police check post in Lagharai area in Mamund tehsil (coded as Khalozai (Bajaur, KPK)). Both rockets are claimed to have missed the building, causing no damages. Following the initial, police personnel and militants exchanged fire. No casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) attacked a police post in Sakhi Pul area in Jamrud town (Khyber, KPK). Two loud explosions were also heard from the area. Following the initial attack by militants, police forces and militants exchanged fire. No casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; Twitter
notes: On 25 September 2024, intervening night, military forces conducted an Intelligence-Based Operation (IBO) targeting TTP-HGB militants in Razmak town (North Waziristan, KPK). During an exchange of fire, eight militants were killed. Sources claim to have identified an Afghan national among the eight militants suspected to have been Pakistani nationals. Military forces also recovered weapons and ammunitions from the scene, in addition to a weapons permit claimed to have been issued by the Afghan government to a militant. 8 fatalities.

On 25 September 2024, unidentified militants (coded as TTP) opened fire targeting a polio vaccination team on Chodhwan Road near Malangi Mor area in Dera Ismail Khan district (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). Police personnel who were escorting the health workers responded with retaliatory fire, forcing the attackers to flee. There were no casualties.

On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire at security force personnel (coded as military) in Central Kurram district (coded as Mamozai (Kurram, KPK). One security personnel was killed and three others were wounded in the attack. 1 fatality and 3 injured.

source: Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication
notes: On 25 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) on motorcycle hurled a hand grenade near a house on Allahabad Road in Sibi city (Sibi, Balochistan). One child was killed and three others were wounded in the explosion. The house belonged to the sub-divisional officer (SDO) of the Sibi Irrigation Department. 1 fatality and 3 injured.

On 24 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead a levies force personnel (coded as police) in Karak district (Karak, KPK) when he was leaving his residence for duty. Militants also looted the personnel's weapon. 1 fatality.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal; TRACterrorism; Twitter
notes: On 24 September 2024, TTP-HGB affiliated Jaish ul-Umari militants exchanged fire with military forces near a market in Mir Ali area (North Waziristan, KPK). Two heavy explosions were also heard, while local sources, stated that fire had engulfed the market. One militant was killed and six other militants and two military personnel were wounded in the clashes. Local sources also claimed that over a dozen cattle had died and were burned to ashes during the exchange of fire. Video sources show various shops and infrastructure destroyed. 1 fatality and 8 injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 24 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated an IED targeting the vehicle of a police personnel in Kulachi area (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK) escorting health workers of the anti-polio vaccination campaign team. The police personnel narrowly escaped the IED attack and remained unhurt in the explosion. No fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Counter Terrorism Department
source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 24 September 2024, police personnel and CTD personnel conducted a joint operation targeting militants (coded as TTP) in Tor Lawang Khel area in Lakki Marwat district (Lakki Marwat, KPK). One militant commander was killed, while two others took refuge in a nearby house. A heavy exchange of gunfire occurred between militants and security forces after reinforcements arrived. During a subsequent search operation, the militants managed to flee the scene. Police claim the deceased militant commander was previously involved in several cases, including extortion, bomb explosions, and attacks on security forces. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 24 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire at a police check post in Sararogha tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK). During the ensuing firefight, a suspected mortar shell struck a nearby house, resulting in one civilian death and three injuries. There are conflicting reports regarding the cause of the explosion. Local sources claimed seeing a quadcopter shortly before the explosion. Some sources claim that it may have been a drone attack while government sources claimed that the incident was a bomb blast carried out by militants. 1 fatality and 3 wounded.

On 22 September 2024, around three missiles were fired towards Sadda town (Kurram, KPK) during clashes between Shiite Tribal Militia and Sunni Tribal militia groups. The explosion caused damages to the infrastructure. Sectarian tensions between Shiite and Sunni tribal militia groups broke out over a land dispute and continued for several days in the area, resulting in dozens of casualties. 4 fatalities were reported for this day, with all 4 fatalities coded to this event.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead a former Intelligence Bureau (IB) employee (coded as former government of Pakistan) in Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Express Tribune (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Reuters; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 September 2024, a police vehicle in a security convoy escorting foreign diplomats detonated after hitting a roadside landmine planted by unidentified militants in the Malam Jabba area (Swat, KPK). The 24 diplomats, hailing from Bosnia, Russia, Vietnam, Ethiopia, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Indonesia, Iran, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, and Portugal, were unharmed while a police officer was killed. The diplomats were on an official visit to Swat, organized by the Islamabad Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ICCI). Images show the police vehicle severely damaged by the blast. The Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) denied responsibility for the attack, following demands from senior officials for an investigation into the security breach that compromised details of the diplomatic convoy. 1 fatality and 3 injured.

source: Balochistan Post; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 22 September 2024, BLF militants clashed with 'death squad' personnel (coded as pro-government militia) near the Dera Bugti border in Barkhan district (Barkhan, Balochistan) for the second consecutive day after clashes first erupted on 21 September 2024 (coded separately), when two militia members were killed and five others were wounded. The BLF claims that during the ongoing clashes, nine additional militia members were killed and over a dozen were injured. However, other sources report that at least four people were killed and three others wounded in total across both events, with two fatalities occurring on 22 September 2024. 2 fatalities coded based on the lowest estimate. 5 injured.
On 21 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) attacked a military camp in Zamuran area (Kech, Balochistan). Casualties unknown.

On 21 September 2024, rival armed groups belonging to Shiite militias and Sunni militias in Balishkhel area (Kurram, KPK) with heavy and automatic weapons, after initial fighting erupted between Shiite Ahmadzai and Sunni Boshehra tribes over construction on disputed territory in Boshehra village on 20 September 2024 (coded separately). Twenty persons were wounded across three events. No fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Anti-Terrorist Force
source: Arab News; Balochistan Post; Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 21 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) opened fire on an Anti-Terrorist Force (ATF) pick-up vehicle (coded as police) on the N-50 Zhob-Dera Ismail Khan National Highway in Silaza area of Zhob district (Zhob, Balochistan). The attack resulted in the death of one ATF officer and left three other personnel wounded as they were enroute to Mani-Khawah area, 2 of whom later succumbed to their injuries and died. 3 fatalities and 1 injured.

source: Balochistan Post; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 21 September 2024, around a dozen BLF militants opened fire at a camp established by 'death squad' personnel (coded as pro-government militia) near the border of Dera Bugti in Ochhari area of Barkhan district (Barkhan, Balochistan) using heavy weapons and rockets. Two pro-government militia personnel were killed and five others were wounded in the attack. The BLF claimed that the 'death squad' operated under the patronage of the Balochistan Chief Minister. Following the attack, the BLF also set fire to a Ufone mobile tower and solar system machinery near the checkpoint (coded separately). 2 fatalities and 5 injured.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 20 September 2024, intervening night, multiple TTP militants opened fire on security forces (coded as military) at a check post in Mishta area in Ladha tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK). In the exchange of gunfire, six security personnel and five militants were killed, while eleven other security personnel were wounded. During the clash, a mortar shell hit a nearby house in the Bospa area, injuring a man and his son. 11 fatalities and 13 injured.

On 20 September 2024, intervening night, clashed erupted between Shiite Ahmadzai tribal militia men and Sunni Boshehra tribal militia men in Boshehra village (Kurram, KPK). The clash began when Boshehra tribesmen started building bunkers on land claimed by the Ahmadzai tribe, sparking conflict over a disputed territory that had been previously settled after clashes in July and August. Sectarian tensions resurfaced in the district as a temporary ceasefire agreement between Shiite and Sunni tribal groups, which was set to expire in October 2024, neared its deadline. Two persons were killed and twenty others were wounded across two events between 20 September - 21 September (coded separately), 1 of whom was confirmed to have been killed on 20 September. 1 fatality and 10 wounded coded to this event.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 20 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) on motorcycle shot dead a sub-inspector the Intelligence Bureau (IB), a government (civilian) intelligence agency, near a market on Miryan Road in Shahdev Khas area of Bannu district (Bannu, KPK). The brother of the sub-inspector was also wounded in the attack. 1 fatality and 1 injured.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 20 September 2024, six children were wounded when an old landmine planted by assailants (coded as TTP) detonated inside their family residence in Makin area (South Waziristan, KPK). The children had found the landmine nearby and unknowingly brought it into their residence, where they began playing with it. 6 injured and no fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 20 September 2024, TTP militants and military force personnel clashed in Nandron area of Birmal tehsil (South Waziristan, KPK). Military forces launched a search operation following the exchange of fire. 2 fatalities and 1 injured.

On 20 September 2024, a boy was wounded in a landmine blast, planted by unidentified assailants (coded as TTP), while grazing cattle in the mountainous area of Saidan village in Upper South Waziristan district (coded as Wana (South Waziristan, KPK)). 1 injured and no fatalities.

On 20 September 2024, a police officer was fatally shot by unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) at Badr Bridge in Wana district (South Waziristan, KPK). The attack occurred as the police officer was waiting at the location, and he died while being transported to the hospital.

Local sources indicated that, on the same day, a large number of military personnel were deployed as part of a broader operation in the region (coded separately). 6 fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; Khyber News; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 11 September 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead a police personnel near a migrant camp in Domail tehsil (Bannu, KPK). The police personnel was assigned to guard a polio vaccination team in the area. 1 fatality.

source: Daily Jang; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 11 September 2024, unidentified militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) hurled three hand grenades at residential quarters of the Agriculture Department in Kharan Bazaar in Kharan district (Kharan, Balochistan), causing loud explosions. Around 11 September 2024 (week of), a young girl was killed by artillery fire in the Momandu Ghuz area in Tirah valley (Khyber, KPK), while fetching water from a natural well. The incident occurred during artillery shelling as part of an ongoing military operation in the region, which had also caused damage to houses in nearby areas.

notes: On 10 September 2024, BLA militants detonated an IED targeting a military camp in Spalanji area of Mastung district (Mastung, Balochistan). BLA claim one military personnel was killed and four others were wounded. 1 fatality and 4 injured.

notes: On 10 September 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) shot dead a local JUI-F leader near Nushki Degree College in Nushki town (Nushki, Balochistan). source: Balochistan Post; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 9 September 2024, intervening night, BLA militants fired several shells from a grenade launcher at a military camp in Mastung town (Mastung, Balochistan). BLA claim at least three personnel were wounded in the attack. 3 injured and no fatalities.

notes: On 9 September 2024, BLA militants detonated an IED targeting a convoy of military infantry personnel in Spalanji area of Mastung district (Mastung, Balochistan). notes: On 9 September 2024, ISKP militants detonated an IED targeting a vehicle carrying health workers from the Pakistan Polio Program (PEI) and their police escort in Wana town (South Waziristan, KPK). actor1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Counter Terrorism Department
notes: On 6 September 2024, CTD personnel conducted an IBO in the Surkhab Refugee Camp area, which houses Afghan refugees in Pishin district (Pishin, Balochistan), and killed five TTP militants. CTD forces surrounded the militants, leading to an exchange of gunfire in which all five militants were killed. No CTD personnel were harmed during the operation. Weapons and ammunition were recovered from the scene, including a submachine gun, a 30-bore TT pistol, two 9mm pistols, ammunition, two hand grenades, an IED, four kilograms of explosives, a primer card, and a motorcycle. 5 fatalities.

The attack partially damaged buildings inside the camp, but no casualties among FC and police personnel were reported. 4 fatalities.

It is likely that Sunni Madgi Kalay Militia fired the rocket targeting Shia Mali Khel tribal militia (the targeted area was also Shia dominated). source: Al Jazeera; Khyber News; News International (Pakistan)
notes: On 24 July 2024, rival groups belonging to the Sunni Madgi Kalay tribal group and the Shiite Mali Khel tribal group exchanged fire using automatic weapons in Boshehra village (Kurram, KPK) after an unidentified gunman, suspected to belong to one of the groups, opened fire during a local council meeting held to negotiate a historical land dispute. The meeting was held to resolve a dispute over farmland originally owned by the Shia tribe and leased to the Sunni tribe, who refused to return it when the lease ended in July, prompting the attack. This initial attack led to a prolonged clash between Shia and Sunni militias across Kurram district (coded separately). While there were no casualties from the initial gunfire, 20 persons were wounded in the subsequent exchange of fire. 20 injured.

On 24 July 2024, a rocket was fired towards the Shia-majority Pewar area and in Tari Mangal area, Kurram, KPK. Two people were killed and twenty were wounded. It is likely that Sunni Madgi Kalay Militia fired the rocket targeting Shia Mali Khel tribal militia. Sectarian tensions between the Madgi Kalay and Mali Khel tribes broke out over a land dispute and continued for several days in the area, resulting in dozens of casualties. 2 fatalities split across locations (1 fatality coded for Pewar).

notes: On 15 July 2024, 10 Jaish ul Fursan Muhammad Nusrat affiliated TTP-HGB militants conducted an attack on military personnel at a high-security military cantonment in Bannu city (Bannu, KPK). TTP-HGB militants rammed an explosive-laden vehicle at the cantonment gate, collapsing a portion of the wall and surrounding infrastructure. A remaining group of armed militants wearing suicide-vests subsequently attempted to enter the cantonment. Military personnel exchanged fire with militants, and two militants detonated themselves in a suicide attack outside the cantonment's security premises. TTP-HGB claim that 'reinforcements' including militants equipped with snipers and night-vision surrounded the cantonment. 8 military personnel and 10 militants were killed and at least a few dozen individuals were wounded in the explosion, including 6 civilians, who were wounded outside the premises when the roof of a residence collapsed from the explosion. Local sources also claim around 141 people, including several civilians, were wounded in the explosion. 18 fatalities and at least a few dozen individuals wounded.

notes: On 15 March 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) opened fire and killed a CTD police personnel in Chenik Chowk area of Sibi tehsil (Sibi, Balochistan). Police managed to apprehend one of the assailants, who was injured during the attack. 1 police personnel killed.
On 15 March 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot and killed a police personnel in Miryan tehsil (Bannu, KPK).

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 14 March 2024, TTP militants ambushed and opened fire at a military force convoy in Datta Khel town (North Waziristan, KPK). 4 military personnel were wounded. No fatalities.
On 14 March 2024, BLA militants hurled a hand grenade at a military post on Turbat Airport Road in Turbat area (Kech, Balochistan). Casualties unknown.
On 14 March 2024, BLA militants opened fire and attacked a military post in Kusano area of Tump tehsil (Tump, Kech). Several explosions and heavy firing were heard. Casualties unknown.

On 13 March 2024, a clash took place between 2 groups of the Keerio community, both the groups exchanged fire, injuring 2 at Fazal Keerio village (coded as Tando Adam) (Sanghar, Sindh), over a land dispute.

On 13 March 2024, police personnel are suspected to have shot and killed an individual under arrest in Ghazni Khel town (Lakki Marwat, KPK) in an incident suspected to be a fake encounter. Although the individual had been detained by the police, authorities claim the attack occurred when another armed group fired upon them. However, eyewitness accounts assert that the individual was killed by police personnel.

On 12 March 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated targeted explosives at a state owned oil and gas exploration company in Musakhel district (coded as Musa Khel Bazar (Musakhel, Balochistan)). 2 people including an employee of the company and an employee of the district were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 12 March 2024, unidentified assailants shot and killed a man in Kalat city (Kalat, Balochistan). The motive of the killing is unclear. 1 fatality.
On 11 March 2024, two TTP militants opened fire and killed a police personnel (likely off-duty based on his location at the time of the event) inside a grocery store in Kulachi city (Kulachi, KPK).
On 11 March 2024, TTP militants opened fire and killed 3 police personnel in a police mobile van at Michni Gate in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Former BLF: Baloch Liberation Front; Military Forces of Pakistan (2022-)
notes: On 11 March 2024, BLF militants shot and killed a government informant in Balichah area (Kech, Balochistan). The deceased, who was suspected of involvement in multiple military operations, was a former BLF militant and had surrendered to the government in 2019. 1 fatality.
On 10 March 2024, a clash took place between the Sabki tribe, both exchanged fire, killing 2 and injuring 2 in Mari Jalbani near Sakrand town (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh), over a land dispute.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 10 March 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot and killed two individuals including a police personnel in Nowshera town (Nowshera, KPK). The individuals were intercepted on their return from a vegetable market and taken off the motorcycle before being killed. 2 fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 10 March 2024, a child was killed and three others were wounded when a mortal shell likely belonging to militants (coded as TTP) exploded in Kulachi area (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK).
