On 10 March 2024, unidentified armed assailants on motorcycle opened fire and killed a police personnel patrolling in a mobile unit in Jacobabad city (Jacobabad, Sindh). 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Baloch Ethnic Group (Pakistan); Health Workers (Pakistan); Students (Pakistan)
notes: Around 10 March 2024 (as reported), intelligence forces suspected to have abducted a Baloch student of the Sargodha Medical College in Sargodha city (Sargodha, Punjab).

On 10 March 2024, police personnel conducted a raid against unidentified assailants in Karal area in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory). One police personnel was shot during the fire exchange. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Frontier Corps
notes: On 8 March 2024, BLA militants attacked an oil and gas extraction company and Frontier Corps personnel deployed for its security in Duki area (Loralai, Balochistan) with automatic weapons. Casualties unknown.
On 8 March 2024, BLA militants opened fire on a civilian vehicle on Garuk Road in Sarawan area (Kharan, Balochistan), carrying minerals and precious stones.
On 8 March 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead an off-duty police personnel inside a shop in Gomal Bazar town (Tank, KPK).
On 8 March 2024, BRG militants planted and detonated explosives on a gas pipeline in Bakhshapur town (Kashmore, Sindh). The targeted 36-inch diameter pipeline carried gas from Sui to Punjab.

On 8 March 2024, unidentified armed assailants shot and killed two Afghan civilians in Block Twenty of Federal B area in Karachi city (Karachi, Sindh) in a targeted attack. The individuals were at a car rental company, searching for a vehicle, when they were attacked. Police ruled out robbery as a motive. 2 fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 8 March 2024, TTP militants opened fire at military and police forces at a joint check post in Maddi area (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). The police returned fire, however, there were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 8 March 2024, intervening night, military forces detected the movement of five militants near the Pakistan-Afghanistan border in North Waziristan district (coded as Miranshah (North Waziristan, KPK). The militants were suspected of attempting to cross into Pakistan. After an intense fire exchange, military forces killed 2 militants and wounded 3 others. 2 fatalities and 3 injured.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 8 March 2024, intervening night, military forces killed eight TTP militants in an operation in North Waziristan district (coded as Miranshah (North Waziristan, KPK)). The operation commenced with the initial killing of four militants, followed by the killing of an additional four as military forces conducted clearance operations in the area. 8 total fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 7 March 2024, unidentified armed assailants shot dead a man in Tajori area (Lakki Marwat, KPK). Initial sources suspected the man was an employee of the Frontier Corps, however, Frontier Corps have confirmed that the individual was not affiliated. 1 fatality.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 7 March 2024, motorcycle-borne TTP militants opened fire and killed two traffic police personnel (likely unarmed since traffic police personnel are not usually armed) near Tank Mor in Darra Pezu town (Lakki Marwat, KPK). 2 fatalities.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 7 March 2024, unidentified armed assailants shot dead a man in Baran area (Bajaur, KPK). This individual had previously survived a gunshot attack a year and a half earlier. No motive clear.

On 6 March 2024, unidentified armed assailants opened fire on a group of 3 transgender individuals near a commercial center in Faqirabad area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). 1 transgender person was killed and 3 others, including a bystander, sustained injuries.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 6 March 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated an IED near the vehicle of a pro-government tribal elder in Mamund area (Bajaur, KPK). The tribal elder managed to escape the attack unharmed. There were no casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 6 March 2024, intervening night, military forces conducted an IBO against TTP militants in Khyber district (coded as Landi Kotal (Khyber, KPK)). After an intense fire exchange, 1 militant was killed. Weapons, ammunitions, and explosives were also recovered. 1 fatality.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 6 March 2024, intervening night, military forces conducted an IBO against TTP militants in Dera Ismail Khan district (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). After an intense fire exchange, 1 militant was killed. Weapons, ammunitions, and explosives were also recovered. 1 fatality.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 6 March 2024, TTP militants opened fire at Shaheed Samiullah check post in Tank district (Tank, KPK). After an exchange of fire, militants fled the scene. There were no casualties.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies; South Asia Terrorism Portal

assoc_actor_2: Hazara Ethnic Group (Pakistan); Shiite Muslim Group (Pakistan)

Two police officers were also injured.

source: Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: Around 3 March 2024 (between 2 - 3 March), a bullet riddled body of a school teacher killed by unidentified assailants was found in Tank district (Tank, KPK). The teacher was abducted by unidentified armed assailants on 2 March 2024.

The individuals are believed to be close aides of Balochistan's incumbent Chief Minister. Unverified reports claimed that the victims were members of a death squad (pro-government militia). 3 Injured.

assoc_actor_2: HM: Hizb-ul-Mujahideen; JeM: Jaish-e-Mohammad; TuM: Tehreek-ul-Mujahideen; LeT: Lashkar-e-Taiba
source: South Asia Terrorism Portal; Times of India

The militant was classified as a 'most-wanted terrorist' by the Indian government and was the secretary general of UJC and the chief of TuM. He was also associated with numerous militant outfits including Lashkar-e-Taiba, Jaish-e-Muhammad, and Hizb-ul-Mujahideen.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 29 February 2024, TTP militants opened fire at a police post and killed a police constable guarding it near Amin Mughal Khel village (coded as Bannu, KPK). After an exchange of fire, 1 police personnel was killed.

On 28 February 2024, militants (coded as TTP) killed and decapitated the body of a polio vaccine worker in Bettani tehsil (Lakki Marwat, KPK) after the individual was returning from work. The body was recovered on 29 February 2024 close to the worker's residence. 1 person killed.

notes: On 28 February 2024, military forces conducted an IBO against TTP militants in North Waziristan district (coded as Miranshah, North Waziristan, KPK). notes: On 28 February 2024, BLA militants attacked police personnel at the Nushki Kishangi check post in Kishangi area of Nushki district (Nushki, Balochistan). BLA stated that the police personnel were later released as they were Baloch.

On 27 February 2024, military forces continued firing intermittent artillery shells in Bolan valley area and Talang areas of Kachhi district (Kachhi, Balochistan) from gunship helicopters and set fire to the house of a Baloch person. Casualties unknown. This was day six of the 'Bolan Operation'.
On 27 February 2024, militants (coded as TTP) opened fire on a police squad in Aijazabad area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). 1 police personnel was killed and 1 was wounded.

source: Khorasan Diary; Khyber News; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: On 27 February 2024, police forces conducted an IBO against TTP militants in Katlang area (Mardan, KPK). The militants hurled a hand grenade and opened fire against police forces. 1 Superintendent (SP) was killed, while 4 other personnel, including a Deputy SP were injured in the clash. In the fire exchange, police killed 1 high value TTP commander and 1 TTP associate. The militants were claimed to have been involved in numerous attacks against security forces, and commanded the Mardan and Nowshera districts for TTP. 3 fatalities.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 27 February 2024, 1 TTP militant opened fire on a police personnel in Badaber area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK) when the assailant was asked to stop by the police. 1 police personnel killed.

On 27 February 2024, BLA militants attacked military forces at Sanjawal area in Bolan valley (Kachhi, Balochistan) in retaliation to the ongoing military operation in Bolan. BLA sniper killed a military personnel and began a fire exchange, killing 3 more military personnel and injuring 'many' others. Military tent also caught fire during the attack and military equipment were destroyed.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 27 February 2024, ISKP militants on motorcycle opened fire and killed two medicine company workers and injured a passer-by on Inayat Kallay-Shagoo Road near Thani area of Mamund tehsil (coded as Khalozai (Bajaur, KPK)). 2 fatalities and 1 injured.

On 26 February 2024, military forces continued shelling in mountainous areas of Bolan valley (Kachhi, Balochistan) with gunship helicopters. The shelling suspectedly killed hundreds of animals and lit fire to the forests. Military forces also arrested 6 persons of the Pashtun Warraich tribe for interrogation. Casualties unknown. This was day five of the 'Bolan Operation'.

On 26 February 2024, assailants (coded as Baloch Separatists) opened fire at a diesel shop and killed a Punjabi man working at the shop in Gwadar city (Gwadar, Balochistan). Police forces suspect the killing to be targeted. 1 person killed.

On 26 February 2024, TTP militants detonated an IED on a police vehicle in Kohi Bara area (coded as Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). TTP sources claim that all personnel were killed. However, police sources confirmed that there were no casualties. Fatalities coded as 0 based on the lowest estimate.

On 26 February 2024, a clash took place between the Mahar community and Jatoi tribe, both fired at each other killing 7 people and injuring 12 in in Pano Aqil taluka (Sindh), over control of a piece of state-owned forest land.

On 26 February 2024, unidentified armed assailants (likely Muslim militia due to attack on Hindu minority group at a wine store) shot and killed a Hindu businessman and wounded his grandson at his wine store on Kasab Khana road in Kalat town (Kalat, Balochistan). 1 killed and 1 injured.
On 26 February 2024, BLF militants attacked a military post on Asiyabad Road in Tump area (Kech, Balochistan) with heavy weapons. Casualties unknown.

On 25 February 2024, military forces continued shelling several areas of Bolan valley (Kachhi, Balochistan) with air support from gunship helicopters. Casualties unknown. This is day four of the 'Bolan Operation'.

On 25 February 2024, unidentified armed men shot and killed a Baloch activist (leader of Jondullah-turn-Jaish-al-Ald) in Karachi - Malir town (Karachi City, Sindh). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. The activist was targeted by proxies suspected to be affiliated with the Iranian state because of his anti-Iran activism.

source: Balochistan Post; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication
notes: On 25 February 2024, a large number of death squad (coded as pro-government militia) personnel opened fire and killed Baloch Separatist militants on patrol in Kahan area (Kohlu, Balochistan) using heavy weapons. A heavy fire exchange took place. One militant deceased was the brother of a BLA martyr, however, the exact identity of the militant group (coded as Baloch Separatists) attacked is unknown. 3 militants were killed.

source: Khorasan Diary; Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 25 February 2024, ISKP militants shot dead a local tribal elder during night prayers in a mosque in Bara town (Khyber, KPK). 1 fatality.

On 24 February 2024, military forces were suspected to conduct helicopter-borne shelling in the mountainous regions surrounding the Bolan valley (Kachhi, Balochistan). Regional reports indicated that sounds of helicopter shelling and explosions were audible in the area. This is day three of the 'Bolan Operation'.

On 24 February 2024, unidentified armed assailants (coded as TTP) on motorcycle opened indiscriminate fire and killed a tribal leader in Ferozekhel area of Lower Orakzai tehsil (coded as Ali Khel, Orakzai, KPK). 1 person was killed.

On 24 February 2024, BLF militants attacked a military force outpost in Apsi Khan area of Tump tehsil (coded as Tump, Kech, Balochistan) with heavy weapons. Military solar systems were destroyed and the walls of the outpost were damaged. 1 military personnel was killed and another was injured.

On 23 February 2024, military forces advanced operations and surrounded the area of Shahragh in Bolan area (Kachhi, Balochistan). A large number of personnel reached Bolan while helicopter flights continued. Military forces fired shellings, mortar shells, and missiles from helicopters in different populated areas. On 23 February 2024, military forces were suspected of having fired mortal shells from helicopters in Jambro and Chakkivadh areas of Harnai district (Harnai, Balochistan). This is day two of the 'Bolan Operation',

On 23 February 2024, military forces were suspected to conduct helicopter-borne shelling in the vicinities of Buzgar, Sangaan, and Laki areas (coded as Sangaan (Sibi, Balochistan)). Regional reports indicated that sounds of heavy explosions were audible in the area. This is day two of the 'Bolan Operation'.
On 23 February 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated a motorcycle-laden explosive outside a hotel in Drazinda Town (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). 3 persons were injured.

On 23 February 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a police personnel (likely off-duty) and wounded two women in Ghareebabad area in Nushki dstrict (Nushki, Balochistan). 2 injured.
On 23 February 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated an explosive near the house of a police personnel in Panjgur area (Panjgur, Balochistan). Casualties unknown.

source: Balochistan Post; Balochwarna News; Khorasan Diary; Sangar Publication

notes: On 22 February 2024, around 10 assailants (coded as Baloch Separatists) abducted 2 laborers from a crushing plant in Alyar Shah area (coded as Bolan (Kachhi, Balochistan). The laborers belonged to North Waziristan district (KPK).

notes: On 2 January 2024, military forces exchanged fire with TTP militants during an operation in Spinwam area (North Waziristan district, KP). Four militants were killed in the encounter. Arms, ammunition and explosives were recovered from the encounter site.

On 2 January 2024, military forces conducted an IBO in Spinwam area (North Waziristan, KPK) killing four militants (coded as TTP) including a suicide bomber. Arms, ammunition and explosives were also recovered from the militants.
On 2 January 2024, police fired at militants (coded as TTP) attempting to initiate an attack against a checkpost at Takhti Khel town (Lakki Marwat district, KP). There were no casualties.

source: Dawn (Pakistan); Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies
notes: On 2 January 2024, police forces open fired at TTP militants in Shahtora Takhtikhel area of Sarai Naurang town (Lakki Marwat, KPK) after they spotted militants attempting to mount an attack on a police post. The militants fled the location and no immediate arrests were made following a search.
On 2 January 2024, BLF militants conducted an IED explosion targeting a military convoy at Mand town (Kech district, Balochistan). BLF claimed seven army personnel were killed.
On 2 January 2024, 2 unidentified armed men on a motorcycle attacked the vehicle of military personnel at Hatim Jatoi roundabout in Dadu city (Dadu, Sindh), injuring 2 military personnel.
On 1 January 2024, unidentified armed men opened fire at the party office, injuring 3 activists of Sunni Tehreek in Moosa colony in Karachi - Gulberg town (Karachi City, Sindh).
On 1 January 2024, military forces of Pakistan abducted five Baloch persons including two woman from the Shirani tribe at Shirani area in Rojhan block area (Jaffarabad district, Balochistan).

On 1 January 2024, unidentified assailants (coded as TTP) fired at a vehicle carrying 2 people including a MOTP candidate in a targeted attack at Mamund tehsil (Bajaur district, KP) prior to the general election. One was killed while the candidate was left injured in the attack.

On 1 January 2024, assailants from one group (sect) conducted 2 separate targeted firing raids (likely a sectarian Shia-Sunni clash due to similar clashes occurring in the region) at Kurram district (coded as Parachinar city, Kurram district, KP). Four persons were left injured in these attacks.
